subject: Re: LOAN
body:
Attn: Darren

Fill in the KYC form and return it with your loan proposal or business 
plan for approval

I wish to acknowledge your mail received today. I also want to thank you 
for your interest in working with our company Crest Platinum Financial 
and our investor to finance your project.

We are very much ready to work with you and also to finance your viable 
projects through our investors and This KYC form should be your first 
step in this loan offer alright and make sure you view our official 
Website: crestplatinum.com  also get back to us through official E-mail 
address johnlewis@crestplatinum.com  as well okay

Our investors finance projects through granting of loans on 3% annual 
interest for a minimum of 10 (ten)  years and above after a 12 months 
grace period. He also finances projects or investment plans under joint 
venture partnership with good understanding in the sharing of profits or 
return on investment.

Below is the ( KYC ) Know your customer in writing form, Please 
carefully fill it so that we can proceed.

1. Client company Name:
2. Incorporation Nu: & Date:
3. Incorporation Jurisdiction (Country/State)
4. Client's Registered Office Address:
5. Client's Telephone Number:
6. Client Website Address:
7. Client Email Address:
8. Description of project/Name:
9. Client Key Contact Name and Title:
10. Who will be responsible for our fund?
11. Who are the Board of Directors and promoters of the company?
12. Client's Banker's Name & Address:
13. Client's Auditor's Name & Address:
14. Client's Solicitor's Name & Address:
15. Client's number of employees:
16. How much funding is required and in what currency?
17. What security (if any) is being offered and what is the value of the 
security?
18. Are you expecting 100% finance from the investor?
19. Is there any existing mortgage/charge on the security? If so, 
provide details:
20. Does the company have a clean credit record?
21. Do you have 3 years of audited financial statements?
22. Are there any politicians Involved (directly or indirectly) in the 
company/project?
23. Have you already submitted the Proposal to any financial institution 
or investment firm?
24. What is your financial strength?

We await for your response with the filled KYC form for review and 
approval of your loan by our company management/investor

Note: other terms and conditions of the loan will officially be 
forwarded to you as soon as the company carry out their due diligence 
and review of your project proposal, Then we will recommend you to our 
investors for approval and loan funding/financing

Thank you in advance as I anticipate your kind response.

Mr. John Lewis,
Financial Consultant
Funding opportunity
Email: johnlewis@crestplatinum.com
Website: crestplatinum.com
Crest Platinum Financia

subject: Re: LOAN
body:
Hello Mr. John Lewis,

Thank you for your detailed email and the opportunity to work with Crest Platinum Financial. I appreciate your willingness to finance my project.

Before I proceed with filling out the KYC form, could you please provide me with more information about the process? Specifically, I'm interested in understanding how the loan approval process works and what factors are considered during this process.

Also, could you clarify what you mean by "good in the sharing of profits or return on"? I would like to understand this better before moving forward.

Lastly, could you tell me more about your investors? It would be great to know who they are and their experience in financing projects similar to mine.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Darren

subject: Re: LOAN
body:
Hello Mr. John Lewis,

Thank you for your prompt response and the detailed information about Crest Platinum Financial's loan offer. I appreciate your willingness to finance my project.

Before I proceed with filling out the KYC form, I have a few questions that I hope you could help me understand better.

1. Could you please elaborate on the annual interest rate for the loans? 
2. What does the grace period entail?
3. In terms of joint venture, how is the profit or return shared?
4. How long does it usually take for a loan application to be reviewed and approved?

I'm looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Darren

subject: Re: LOAN
body:
Hello Mr. John Lewis,

Thank you for your detailed email and the opportunity to work with Crest Platinum Financial. I appreciate your willingness to finance my project.

Before I proceed with filling out the KYC form, could you please provide me with more information about the loan terms? Specifically, I'm interested in understanding the annual interest rate, grace period duration, and any potential penalties for early repayment.

Also, could you clarify what you mean by "good in the sharing of profits or return on"? Does this refer to a specific percentage of profit sharing?

Lastly, regarding security for the loan - are there any specific assets that your company typically prefers as security? And how is the value of these assets determined?

I look forward to hearing from you soon so we can move forward with this process.

Best wishes,
Darren

subject: Re: LOAN
body:
Hello Mr. John Lewis,

Thank you for your prompt response and the detailed information about Crest Platinum Financial's loan process. I appreciate your willingness to assist with my project.

However, before proceeding further, I have a few questions that I would like to clarify:

1. Could you please provide more details about the annual interest rate for the loans?
2. What is the grace period you mentioned? Is it applicable to all types of loans?

subject: Clarifications Regarding Loan Process at Crest Platinum Financial
body:
Dear Darren,

Thank you for your email and for considering Crest Platinum Financial 
for your project financing needs. I'm glad to hear that you found the 
information provided helpful, and I'm here to address your questions to 
ensure clarity and transparency throughout the process.

Regarding your inquiries:

1. **Annual Interest Rate:** The annual interest rate for our loans 
varies depending on several factors, including the type of loan, loan 
amount, and individual creditworthiness. To provide you with specific 
details tailored to your situation, I kindly request that you provide 
more information about your project and financing requirements. Once I 
have a better understanding of your needs, I'll be able to provide you 
with an accurate quote.

2. **Grace Period:** The grace period refers to a period of time during 
which borrowers are not required to make loan payments, typically at the 
beginning of the loan term. This period allows borrowers to focus on 
initiating their projects and generating revenue before beginning 
repayment. The availability and duration of the grace period may vary 
depending on the type of loan and specific terms negotiated. I would be 
happy to discuss the options available and provide further details based 
on your preferences.

3. **Joint Ventures and Profit Sharing:** Joint ventures involve 
collaboration between two or more parties to undertake a specific 
project or business activity. In the context of project financing, 
profit sharing in joint ventures typically involves an agreed-upon 
distribution of profits among the parties based on their respective 
contributions, risks, and responsibilities outlined in the joint venture 
agreement. The specific terms of profit sharing would be determined 
through negotiations and documented in the joint venture agreement to 
ensure clarity and fairness to all parties involved.

4. **Security and Accepted Assets:** Crest Platinum Financial accepts a 
variety of assets as security for loans, depending on the nature of the 
project and the loan amount. Common types of assets accepted as security 
may include real estate, equipment, inventory, accounts receivable, and 
other valuable assets with sufficient liquidity and market value. The 
suitability of assets for security will be assessed on a case-by-case 
basis to ensure adequate collateral coverage and risk mitigation.

I hope this addresses your questions, Darren. If you require further 
clarification or have additional inquiries, please don't hesitate to 
reach out. I'm here to assist you every step of the way and ensure that 
your financing needs are met effectively.
Best regards,

John Lewis
Loan Officer
Crest Platinum Financial

subject: Re: Clarifications Regarding Loan Process at Crest Platinum Financial
body:
Hello Darren,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I'm thrilled to hear about your interest in Crest Platinum Financial's project financing options. It's always a pleasure to assist someone who is eager to learn more.

The annual interest rate for our loans can vary based on several factors such as the type of loan, the loan amount, and individual circumstances. Could you provide more details about your project and financing needs? This will help me give you a more accurate quote.

A grace period is a time frame during which borrowers are not required to make loan payments. This usually occurs at the start of the loan term, allowing borrowers to focus on their projects before starting repayments. The length and specifics of this period can differ depending on the type of loan and other factors. Would you like more information on this?

Joint ventures involve collaboration between two or more parties for a specific project or business activity. In terms of project financing, profit sharing in joint ventures typically involves an allocation of profits among the parties based on their respective contributions, risks, and agreements outlined in the joint venture agreement. Are there any specific aspects of this that you'd like to know more about?

Crest Platinum Financial accepts various types of assets as security for loans, including real estate, equipment, inventory, accounts receivable and other valuable assets with sufficient liquidity and market value. The suitability of these assets for security is assessed individually to ensure adequate collateral coverage and risk management.

I hope this answers some of your questions! If there's anything else you're curious about or need further clarification on, please don't hesitate to ask.

Best wishes,
Darren

subject: Re: Clarifications Regarding Loan Process at Crest Platinum Financial
body:
Salaam,

Our Investors (Crest Platinum Investment Financial Group) is 
wholly-owned by Crest Platinum Investment Financial Group one of Gulf 
Investment Financial Group Shares Directors and  founders of Addax 
Investment Bank, Bahrain,widely acknowledged as one of the best seasoned 
investors in the region.

Crest Platinum Investment Financial Group has a paid up capital of  $5 
Billion and is rated A3 by Moody's  Investor Services.
Our investors are interested in providing financing as debt finance/loan 
at 3% return on investment with a 2-year grace period and contract valid 
from 1 to 10 years. Our investment size is from $1 Million and above in 
all sectors of investment.

We would be pleased to receive your comprehensive business plan or 
presentation for a review with our investors.

CC: Investors

Mr.Mohammed A. Khalifa Saeed
Chairman/ CEO
Phone:+971 56 374 5919

Crest Platinum Financial

subject: Re: Clarifications Regarding Loan Process at Crest Platinum Financial
body:
Hello A. Khalifa Saeed,

Thank you for reaching out and providing such detailed information about Crest Platinum Investment Financial Group. It's impressive to hear about your group's paid-up capital and the rating by Moody's Investor Services.

I'm intrigued by the opportunity of receiving financing as a debt finance loan with a return on investment. Could you please elaborate more on this? Specifically, I'm interested in understanding the terms of the grace period and what sectors you typically invest in.

Also, could you provide some guidance on what should be included in the business plan or project proposal that needs to be submitted for review?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Darren
